title: C3 Generative AI: Leveraging Enterprise Data with Accurate Insights
originSummary: The text explores the challenges and solutions of using generative AI to extract insights from enterprise data, particularly focusing on C3 AI's offerings.
C3 Generative AI tackles issues related to specialized domains, accuracy evaluation, data sources, privacy/security, and deployment in enterprise settings.

This solution utilizes information retrieval and complex reasoning, demonstrating high accuracy in real-world case studies. It can be tailored to specific industries and has potential for further innovation.

title: IBM Introduces watsonx.governance to Enhance Trust and Oversight in Generative AI Models
originSummary: IBM has introduced watsonx.governance, a tool designed to assist organizations in managing and overseeing generative AI models.
The tool enables businesses to identify and address potential risks, ensure transparency and compliance with regulations, and monitor for fairness and bias.
Watsonx.governance is part of the IBM watsonx AI and data platform, which offers a range of software products and tools for AI development and data management.

title: Most Organizations Unprepared for Risks of Third-Party and Generative AI: Research
originSummary: MIT SMR and BCG conducted research on responsible AI and found that most organizations are not prepared for the risks of generative AI tools.
Many companies rely on third-party AI tools, including generative AI, which have significant risks.
The research offers recommendations to help organizations address these risks and implement responsible AI practices, based on a global executive survey and expert panels.

title: Organizations Embrace Generative AI Despite Security Concerns
originSummary: A survey of IT decision makers finds that 89% of organizations perceive generative AI tools as a security risk, yet 95% of organizations are already utilizing them.
23% of users do not monitor the usage of AI tools, and 33% have not implemented any security measures.
IT teams, rather than employees, are the main drivers behind the adoption of AI tools, highlighting the need for organizations to prioritize secure governance before further AI adoption.

title: Companies Overlook Security Risks in Rush to Adopt Generative AI, Survey Finds
originSummary: A study by Zscaler shows that many companies are adopting generative AI tools without adequately considering the security risks associated with them.
89% of organizations surveyed perceive generative AI tools as risky, yet a staggering 95% of them are still using these tools.

One-third of businesses have not implemented any additional security measures to protect against generative AI, and a quarter are not monitoring its usage at all, highlighting the need for businesses to reassess security measures. Although interest in AI is expected to increase substantially by the end of the year, time is limited for companies to address security concerns.

title: Third Door Media Launches SearchBot, a Collection of AI Marketing Tools to Assist Marketers
originSummary: Third Door Media has launched SearchBot, a suite of marketing generative AI tools designed to help marketers in the AI-powered marketing industry.
The upgraded version includes pre-contextualized chatbots, generative AI image tools, and prompt suggestions.
Since its launch, SearchBot has garnered over 15,000 sessions and engaged in nearly 4,000 chats with marketers globally.

title: Limitations and Advancements of Large Language Models in Generative AI
originSummary: Large language models (LLMs) like GPT, Bard, and Llama 2 are widely used for text generation, code completion, and translation, but they have limitations such as mediocre generated text, inaccuracies in translations, and bugs in generated code.
Training LLMs requires a large amount of text and many parameters for the neural network, and they have grown in size over time.
Concerns exist about the environmental and financial costs of larger LLMs and the need for curated datasets. The fine-tuning of LLMs for specific tasks is also important.
The introduction of the Transformer architecture in 2017 sparked the recent explosion of LLMs.
